definition: to kneel/to go down on one's knees
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Abruzzi: I kneel  only  to god. Don't  see him here.
sentences.chinese: 我只向上帝下跪，他不可在这儿。

sentences.english: She knelt down and bowed her head in prayer.
Abruzzi: I kneel only to God.
The incident reflects the harsh reality for Chinese art-house films.
sentences.chinese: 这次的下跪事件反映出当今中国艺术电影的严酷现实。

sentences.english: Geng Jinping yesterday knelt before the court, begging for victims' forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 耿金平昨天在庭上下跪，乞求受害人的宽恕。

sentences.english: We bend the knee to no one human, any more than we bend to the abstraction of an ideal.
sentences.chinese: 我们不对着任何人类屈膝，我们只对抽象的理想下跪。

sentences.english: Predictably, the Jingzhou government's reaction to the kneeling professors was less than enthusiastic.
sentences.chinese: 可以料到，荆州政府对于下跪教授的回应并不积极。

sentences.english: Instead of kneeling in the sand, Catching teardrops in my hand.
sentences.chinese: 以替代沙粒上的下跪，抓住手中滴下的泪水。

sentences.english: Give obituary notice it when some unfilial shall kneel down in front of a longer period of time crying.
sentences.chinese: 故有些不孝子报丧时须在舅家门口下跪痛哭较长时间。

sentences.english: They knelt before the image of Buddha.
Mr. Jiang dropped to the ground several times and begged them to stop.
sentences.chinese: 蒋先生几次给人们下跪并请求他们停下脚步。

sentences.english: Death is the black camel that kneels before every door.
sentences.chinese: 死亡像一头黑骆驼，在每一家门前下跪。

sentences.english: We read of this man that three times each day he kneeled in God 's presence.
sentences.chinese: 我们获悉，这个男人在上帝面前一天下跪三次。

sentences.english: The boy or girl is made to write a confession and kneel in front of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们被要求写交代材料并在父母面前下跪。

definition: to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to admit an error/to acknowledge one's mistake
to apologize for an offense/to offer one's apology for a fault
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
